member.name: T:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods
member.summary:
Down holder Pipetting methods class.
This class contains the pipetting methods in case down holder Y/Z devices are used. Typically this methods will be wrapped by the arm using them. That means an arm which is able to do pipetting typically has a wrapper method for the used pipetting methods.

member.summary: Helper function for easier Y/Z device access
member.param: The index of the Y/Z device to check/get
member.returns: a valid pipetting Y/Z device or null if tip not used/usable for pipetting

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.MoveAspPos(Sias.PipArm.STipMap,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,Sias.PipArm.SDetectionPar,Sias.PipArm.SPipettingPar,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Move to aspiration position.
This method is derivated from \nlink{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.MoveAspPos}. In addition to the origin it takes care about the cavities "HoldOffset" and "GuideOffset" custom properties.
member.details:
The   "GuidOffset" custom property defines a guide offset [mm] between tip holder case and down holder used for guiding while piercing (moving down).
 The   "HoldOffset" custom property defines a hold offset [mm] (relative to the cavities travel height) to hold the item down while moving the tip(s) up.

For details this methods please reference 
link{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.MoveAspPos}.
member.returns: The \ref Used_Tips "tips" using tracking at aspiration

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.MoveDspPos(Sias.PipArm.STipMap,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,Sias.PipArm.SDetectionPar,Sias.PipArm.SPipettingPar,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Move to aspiration position.
This method is derivated from \nlink{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.MoveAspPos}. In addition to the origin it takes care about the cavities "HoldOffset" and "GuideOffset" custom properties.
member.details:
The   "GuidOffset" custom property defines a guide offset [mm] between tip holder case and down holder used for guiding while piercing (moving down).
 The   "HoldOffset" custom property defines a hold offset [mm] (relative to the cavities travel height) to hold the item down while moving the tip(s) up.

For details this methods please reference 
link{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.MoveAspPos}.
member.returns: The \ref Used_Tips "tips" using tracking at aspiration

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.ExecuteTemplate(Sias.PipArm.STipMap,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,Sias.PipArm.SBasePipettingTemplate)
member.summary:
Pipetting template execution
This method is derivated from \nlink{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.ExecuteTemplate}. In addition to the origin it takes care about moving out of the cavities in case of having down holder Y/Z devices with active down holding (HoldPosition>0).
member.param: Used cavities (one for each available tip)

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.DetectVolume(Sias.PipArm.STipMap,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,Sias.PipArm.SDetectionPar)
member.summary:
Detect liquid volume in cavities.
This method is derivated from \nlink{Sias::PipArm,SPipettingMethods.DetectVolume}. In addition to the origin it takes care about the cavities "HoldOffset" and "GuideOffset" custom properties and about moving out of the cavities after detection.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.HoldTips
member.summary: This property returns a tip map with all Y/Z devices supporting down holding

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.AspirateHoldOffset
member.summary:
Aspiration hold offset property
With the aspiration hold offset an application may set a hold offset for aspirate even if the concerned cavities are not marked with a "HoldOffset" custom property.
member.details: \b Important: If a cavity is marked with a "HoldOffset" custom property the AspirateHoldOffset will be ignored!
member.value: Hold offset [mm] above the cavity. Values smaller or equal to 0 will deactivate down holding for aspirate.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.DispenseHoldOffset
member.summary:
Dispense hold offset property
With the dispense hold offset an application may set a hold offset for dispense even if the concerned cavities are not marked with a "HoldOffset" custom property.
member.details: \b Important: If a cavity is marked with a "HoldOffset" custom property the AspirateHoldOffset will be ignored!
member.value: Hold offset [mm] above the cavity. Values smaller or equal to 0 will deactivate down holding for dispense.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.MethodsSupported
member.summary:
Methods supported property.
This property is used to verify the method block. In case of the pipetting methods, it verifies if the arm is valid and at least one pipetting Y/Z device is available.
member.value: True if execution possible otherwise false

member.name: T:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipettingMethods.ErrorCodes
member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::DownHolder::SDownHolderDevice errors.

member.name: T:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice
member.summary:
Pipetting Y/Z device class.
The pipetting Y/Z device is a complex device representing the part of the pipetting arm connected to the Y traverse.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_DownHolder
In addition to the standard Y- and Z- \nlink{Sias::Motor,SMotorDevice} the pipetting Y/Z device includes a \nlink{Sias::PipPump,SPipPumpDevice}.
The pipetting Y/Z device is derived from a standard Y/Z device. In addition to the Y/Z device members the DownHolder Y/Z class implements - properties for the needed pipetting pump configuration - properties for the needed tip adapter - a property for the tip state (\b see \nlink{Sias.DownHolder,STipState}) - methods for picking and dispensing liquid - a method to empty the tip . The derivation overwrites the ZWorktablePos and ZMotorPos to correct the heights by the length of the tip adapter and the tip.
\image html "SPipYZDevice.png"

XML string configuration constructor.
This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.#ctor(System.String,Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32,Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32,Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32,Sias.PipPump.SPipPumpDevice)
member.summary:
Manual generation constructor.
This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters. Important: MaxTipDistance is set to 0 inside this constructor. It may be required to change it manually after construction.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DownHolderZWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate down holder worktable position from a given motor position

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DownHolderZMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary:
Calculate down holder motor position from a given worktable position
This function is taking care about a valid down holder position. - On down moves it tries to keep the guide offset as long as the position does not become lower then the defined hold position. - On up moves it tries to stay (move) to hold position. . Important: Independent of guide offset and hold position the down holder will not move below the tip peak or above tip holder case! In addition the move is limited to defined move range of the down holder motor.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Init pipetting Y/Z device. This first calls the base initialization initializing the Z, X and Y motor. Then it initializes the pipetting pump. Take care that the pipetting pump is not initialized above a wash station !

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.PrepareZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Prepare Z motor move to an absolute worktable position.
The method will take care about the down holder Z device: - I down holding inactive the down holder will move in parallel to the tip Z motor.
Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.PrepareRelativeZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare relative Z motor move. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Relative Z position in worktable coordinates [mm]

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.PrepareZScanMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor scan move to an absolute worktable position. The scan move gets the submerge way after detection. As we have no way to have an acceleration on addition this will always use the modules default acceleration! Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.PrepareZBlockMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor block move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Block mode, this defines the moving force. In a normal configured system that means 1=strong, 2=middle, 3=weak

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Prepare Z motor travel move if necessary.
This method makes sure, that the Z motor moves at least to the defined travel height. If the Z motor is above the defined travel height it will not move.
member.returns: The execution group of the prepared CAN devices

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.AddArmMethods(Sias.BaseDev.SBaseArmMethodsCollection,Sias.BaseDev.SBaseArmDevice)
member.summary: Add supported arm methods to given arm method collection a collection.
member.remarks: Take care each arm should not have each method block more then once!
member.returns: A collection of all supported arm method blocks

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DownHolderZMotor
member.summary: DownHolder Z Motor property

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DownHolderZFactor
member.summary: Z motor rescaling factor. This factor allows to rescale the Z motor positions. Normally this is only used to revert the motor.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DownHolderZOffset
member.summary: DownHolder Z Offset

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.ZMax
member.summary: Maximum Z motor move range [mm].

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.MaxTipDistance
member.summary:
Maximum distance between downholder an tip property
This property is used to define how much the downholder is allowed to move below the tip. usually this is a bit less then the height of the downholder guiding ring.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.MaxTipInsertion
member.summary:
Max tip insertion property
This property defines the additional tip movement that can be performed after initialisation without having the level sensor case touching the downholder.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DefaultExecutionGroup
member.summary: Default execution group for the DownHolder Y/Z device property

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.HoldPosition
member.summary:
Actual hold position property
The hold position property is used to define a down holding position. It will be set before moving out from a cavity and will be reset automatically when moving the Y/Z device back to travel height.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.GuideOffset
member.summary:
Piercing guide Offset property
This property defined a guide offset between tip holder and down holder [mm]. This property is used while piercing. The system tries to keep the guide offset as long as the down holder is above the hold position. In case the down holder would becomes lower then the hold position the guide offset may be reduced automatically.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.ZHolderOffset
member.summary:
Holder offset property
The holder offset defines the distance between the down holder and the tip under init conditions. This is used to check if the down holder motor and the Z Motor will get blocked.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DeviceName
member.summary: Name of the pipetting Y/Z device. Changing the name of the pipetting Y/Z device will result in changing the names of all connected sub devices.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.ExecutionGroup
member.summary: This property returns or sets the execution group of all sub modules connected to this pipetting Y/Z device.

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipYZDevice.DeviceState
member.summary: Get Device state.

member.summary: disable max tip distance property

member.name: T:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipArmDevice
member.summary:
Pipetting arm device class.
The pipetting arm device is a complex device representing a pipetting arm on a sias instrument.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_DownHolder
A pipetting arm has an X motor and at least one pipetting Y/Z sub device with Y- and Z- motors and a pipetting pump.
In difference to the first SDK Version the pipetting arm does \b not implement any pipetting methods. Instead it implements a Pipetting property providing a \nlink{Sias::DownHolder,SPipettingMethods} class including the pipetting methods as well as the additional configuration properties.
\image html "SDownHolderDevice.png"
member.remarks: \b Remark: To make sure that the tips are out of the range of accessible objects before releasing the access mode it is needed to define a gripper path.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipArmDevice.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor.
Creates a new instance of the SDownHolderDevice class.

member.summary: XML Configuration constructor.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SDownHolderDevice class by defining the configuration data.

member.summary: Initialize the pipetting arm device.

member.name: M:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipArmDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Prepare travel move.
This method prepares travel moves for all Y/Z devices of the arm. It returns the execution group(s) of all prepared modules, but it does not start the movement. This allows to move up all axis at the same time.
member.param: The Travel height in worktable coordinates
member.returns: the execution group of all prepared devices

member.name: P:Sias.DownHolder.SDownHolderPipArmDevice.DeviceName
member.summary:
Name of the pipetting arm device.
Changing the name of the pipetting arm device results in changing the names of all connected sub devices.
